q_en: Have all of John's orders been completed?

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "John"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = 2;
steps.description: Retrieve all order IDs for the customer "John"

steps.sql: SELECT o.id, CASE WHEN SUM(st.completed_number) = SUM(op.number) THEN 'Completed' ELSE 'Not Completed' END AS order_status FROM orders o JOIN order_product op ON o.id = op.order_id JOIN sewing_tasks st ON op.id = st.order_product_id WHERE o.user_id = 2 GROUP BY o.id;
steps.description: Check the status of all sewing tasks for each order to determine if they are completed

response:
Hey there! ğŸ˜„ Let's take a look at John's orders and see if they've all been completed. Here's what I found:

| Order ID | Status       |
|----------|--------------|
| 2        | Completed    |
| 10       | Not Completed|

So, it seems like not all of John's orders have been completed. Order ID 2 is all set, but Order ID 10 still needs some work. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! ğŸ˜Š
